thread.title: Phil Neville stunned into four-letter rant at Valencia as former club collapses in Copa del Rey defeat to Celta Vigo
thread.title_full: Phil Neville stunned into four-letter rant at Valencia as former club collapses in Copa del Rey defeat to Celta Vigo

author: wdownes
title: Phil Neville stunned into four-letter rant at Valencia as former club collapses in Copa del Rey defeat to Celta Vigo
text:
EFL F*** VALENCIA! Phil Neville stunned into four-letter rant at Valencia as former club collapses in Copa del Rey defeat to Celta Vigo 
The home side was 3-0 down inside the opening 20 minutes and finally lost 4-1 by WALLY DOWNES JR Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments PHIL NEVILLE ripped into Valencia on Tuesday night as his former side was smashed 4-1 by Celta Vigo in the Copa del Rey. 
The ex- Manchester United and Everton man was a coach at the La Liga side last season when brother Gary was, very briefly, the manager and he returned to La Mestalla excited to see the cup clash. @fizzer18 7 Phil Neville was shocked by Valencia’s early collapse against Celta Vigo 
But the home side was 3-0 down inside the opening 20 minutes and the ex-England defender blew his lid – albeit in Spanish. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog . AP:Associated Press Phil and Gary Neville did not do well at Valencia Getty Images Gary was sacked after just four months and a 7-0 loss to Barcelona Phil Neville slated for 'boring' commentary 
And after going 1-0 down from a 3 rd minute Iago Aspas penalty, Neville wrote: “F*** Valencia.” 
And as Celta added their third he wrote: Madre mia el Valencia. 
Literally translated ‘madre mia’ means ‘oh mother’ but it’s a fine substitute for ‘Oh my god’ or ‘Holy s***’ 
After his 1.4million followers saw the messages – with thousands retweeting the outbursts – Neville appears to have deleted them. 
After leaving Valencia, following Gary ’s disastrous four-month spell that yielded just three league wins, Phil moved on and is currently looking for another post. Gary Neville gets lost in translation on the touchline Literally translated ‘madre mia’ means ‘oh mother’ but it’s a fine substitute for ‘Oh my god’ or ‘Holy s***’ Gary Neville: The referee was a joke 
He said after his brief Spanish stint: “I am still learning, I am still young in terms of managerial experience, but the last three years I've gathered a lot of information. 
“I just feel at the moment maybe my next job I think I'll probably want to go on my own and be my own man, back myself and my own ability. 
"I loved every minute of it. To come away from the experience with a language under your belt, with the experience that I've had this year would probably take people five years to experience. Reuters Phil and Gary Neville did not last long at Valencia and are back in England related stories 'SHE'S TERRIFIED' Jennifer Lopez files restraining order against 'violent stalker' who has left her 'fearing for her life' keith's mike kind of guy Sports Direct's Mike Ashley expected to support chairman Keith Hellawell after vote on his future SUNEMPLOYMENT Gym careers are a good fit for the New Year and there is money to be made as a personal trainer Remember this? Brandon Block once stormed the stage at the BRIT Awards and was dragged away by security guards BUGG IN HER EYE Roxy Horner says yellow to the New Year in bright bikini just days after confirming Jake Bugg romance Corbis Phil said he was now looking to go into management on his own Getty Images 7 The former Everton defender is a regular pundit on TV and radio 
"Three or four different managers, unrest with supporters, situations with players, playing against Barcelona and getting beaten 7-0 - these are experiences you can't buy. 
“You can go on every course in the world that you want, but you can't buy the experience I've had this year. 
“In terms of my overall development as a coach, hopefully a manager, and as a person, I cannot think of a negative about the whole situation.”
